paragraphs.title: Association rule mining
paragraphs.text:
%md
# Association rule mining on Big data using retail transactions
Spark 2.0 +

msg.data:
Association rule mining on Big data using retail transactions

Spark 2.0 +

paragraphs.title: load example data
paragraphs.text:
%sh
if ! hdfs dfs -test -e "/user/zeppelin/retail_export"; then

    wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/praisan/hello-world/master/retail_hive_export.zip

    unzip retail_hive_export.zip
    hdfs dfs -mkdir -p /user/zeppelin/retail
    hdfs dfs -put retail_export /user/zeppelin/
fi

paragraphs.title: import to Hive
Checking
Create Spark DataFrame
Data preprocessing
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
# get all items in one order
transactionsTDf=retailTransactions.rdd.map(lambda row:(row[0],[row[1]])).reduceByKey(lambda x,y:x+y).toDF(["order_id","items"])
transactionsTDf.cache()
transactionsTDf.show(5,truncate=False)

%pyspark
print("There are "+str(transactionsTDf.count())+" orders");

paragraphs.title: Association rule mining using FPGrowth model
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
from pyspark.ml.fpm import FPGrowth
fpGrowth = FPGrowth(itemsCol="items", minSupport=10/57431.0, minConfidence=0.5)
model = fpGrowth.fit(transactionsTDf)

paragraphs.title: Using
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
from pyspark.sql.functions import col, size
trans_=spark.sql("SELECT DISTINCT order_item_order_id,order_item_product_id FROM retail.order_items LIMIT 20000").rdd.map(lambda row:(row[0],[row[1]])).reduceByKey(lambda x,y:x+y).toDF(["order_id","items"])
#model.transform(trans_).where(size(col("prediction"))>0).sort('items').show(20,truncate=False)
model.transform(trans_).sort('items').show(20,truncate=False)
#model.transform(transactionsTDf).where(size(col("prediction"))>0).sort('items').show(20,truncate=False)

paragraphs.title: Optional
paragraphs.text:
%md
Show results

%pyspark
# Display frequent itemsets.
freqItemsets=model.freqItemsets.sort('freq', ascending=False)
freqItemsets.show(10)
z.show(freqItemsets)

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
# Display generated association rules.
associationRules=model.associationRules.sort('confidence',ascending=False)
associationRules.show(10)
z.show(associationRules)

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
associationRules.count()

%md
show the name of product in rules

%pyspark
# get distinct product id in rules
prodId=associationRules.rdd.flatMap(lambda x:x.antecedent+x.consequent).distinct().collect()
prodId=[[i] for i in prodId]
prodInRules=sc.parallelize(prodId).toDF(['prod_id'])
prodInRules.show()

%pyspark
# get product name
prodInRules.registerTempTable("prodInRules")
freqProduct=spark.sql("SELECT product_id, product_name FROM prodInRules JOIN retail.products ON prodInRules.prod_id=products.product_id");
freqProduct.show(truncate=False)

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
# show product name in rules
freqProductName = dict(freqProduct.collect())
rules=associationRules.collect()
for fi in rules:
    print('conf=',fi[2],[freqProductName[int(x)] for x in fi[0]],' ===> ',[freqProductName[int(x)] for x in fi[1]])

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
squared_udf(5)

%pyspark
import pandas as pd

%pyspark
#create empty dataframe
df = pd.DataFrame()

#create a column

df['name'] = ['Damian','Sarah','Ray']
df['employed']=['Yes','Yes','No']
df['age'] = [32,29,19]

#view dataframe
df

msg.data:
name employed  age
0  Damian      Yes   32
1   Sarah      Yes   29
2     Ray       No   19

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
#create a function
def uppercase_column_name(dataframe):
  #cap all the column headers
  dataframe.columns = dataframe.columns.str.upper()
  return dataframe

%pyspark
#create a pipeline that applies both functions
(df.pipe(mean_age_by_group,col='employed')
    #then apply the uppercase function
   .pipe(uppercase_column_name)
   )
%pyspark
